result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Charles Wichelmann

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:29 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer not in court. Defendant Steven Charles Wichelmann in court. Includes 22CF142, 22CF317, and 22CF339. Court reviews case. Unknown why Atty Selmer is not in court. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:01 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy Defendant Steven Charles Wichelmann in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Steven Charles Wichelmann.  Attorney Alec Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. INCLUDES: ARGN for 22CF317 & 22CF399 and STC for 22CF142.    22CF317:  Information has been filed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.    22CF399:  Information has been filed.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Court confirms address.  Court will set with EFV.  Bond continues.  Adjourned: 1:07
Settlement conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Per TCH: Defendant may have been in wrong courtroom. warrant quashed - reschedule arraignment.  gll

1:17 PM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   Defendant Steven Charles Wichelmann not in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Steven Charles Wichelmann.  Attorney Holly Rockow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   INCLUDES: 22CF142, 22CF317 & 22CF399   States notes prior missed appearance and requests warrant.  Court issues body only warrant. Adjoining States.  Adjourned: 1:19

to appear via Zoom for 7/27 ARGN. Filed by Atty Selmer. km
Approved by TCH on 7-27-2022. JA let Atty. Selmer know. rg/km
Filed by ADA Brekken. km

03:01 PM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Steven Charles Wichelmann appeared.  INCLUDES: Prelims for 22CF317 & 22CF399 and STC for 22CF142.  DF wishes to waive the Preliminary hearing for 22CF317 & 22CF399.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court confirms address.  Bond continues.  Adjourned: 3:07  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on July 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

*AMENDED*

Includes 22CF142 and 22CF317.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to drug testing 2 times per week on Tuesdays and Fridays by 4:00 PM. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:51 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Steven Charles Wichelmann appeared. Includes 22CF142 and 22CF399. Court questions non-appearance. Atty Selmer states DE had COVID and DE doesn't currently have a cellphone, as it was seized, and requests to address. Court reviews files and notes DE hasn't been testing as required. Court states prelim is needed in 22CF399. Court sets Preliminary Hearing on 22CF399 before Court Commissioner and STC in 22CF142. Atty Selmer requests DE's phone be released. ADA Brekken responds and states phone cannot be returned, as it may have evidentiary value. Atty Selmer requests to modify reporting to JSC. Court orders Defendant to report to JSC on Tuesdays and Fridays, rather than reporting every day to JSC and amends bonds in 22CF317 and 22CF142. Adjourned at 11:05 AM.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Brekken. km
appointing Atty Selmer.  gll
